dataContractSpecification.description: Specifies the Data Contract Specification being used.

id.description: Specifies the identifier of the data contract.

title.description: The title of the data contract.

version.description: The version of the data contract document (which is distinct from the Data Contract Specification version or the Data Product implementation version).

description.description: A description of the data contract.

owner.description: The owner or team responsible for managing the data contract and providing the data.

my-custom-required-field.description: The owner or team responsible for managing the data contract and providing the data.

name.description: The identifying name of the contact person/organization.

url.description: The URL pointing to the contact information. This MUST be in the form of a URL.

email.description: The email address of the contact person/organization. This MUST be in the form of an email address.

contact.description: Contact information for the data contract.

info.description: Metadata and life cycle information about the data contract.

type.description: The type of the data product technology that implements the data contract.

project.description: An optional string describing the server.

dataset.description: An optional string describing the server.

location.description: An optional string describing the server. Must be in the form of a URL.

topic.description: An optional string describing the server.

type.description: The type of the data product technology that implements the data contract.

path.description: The relative or absolute path to the data file(s).

terms.description: The terms and conditions of the data contract.

usage.description: The usage describes the way the data is expected to be used. Can contain business and technical information.

limitations.description: The limitations describe the restrictions on how the data can be used, can be technical or restrictions on what the data may not be used for.

billing.description: The billing describes the pricing model for using the data, such as whether it's free, having a monthly fee, or metered pay-per-use.

noticePeriod.description: The period of time that must be given by either party to terminate or modify a data usage agreement. Uses ISO-8601 period format, e.g., 'P3M' for a period of three months.

models.description: Specifies the logical data model. Use the models name (e.g., the table name) as the key.

type.description: The type of the model. Examples: table, view, object. Default: table.

fields.description: Specifies a field in the data model. Use the field name (e.g., the column name) as the key.

description.description: An optional string describing the semantic of the data in this field.

type.description: The logical data type of the field.

required.description: An indication, if this field must contain a value and may not be null.

unique.description: An indication, if the value must be unique within the model.

enum.description: A value must be equal to one of the elements in this array value. Only evaluated if the value is not null.

minLength.description: A value must greater than, or equal to, the value of this. Only applies to string types.

maxLength.description: A value must less than, or equal to, the value of this. Only applies to string types.

format.description: A specific format the value must comply with (e.g., 'email', 'uri', 'uuid').

pattern.description: A regular expression the value must match. Only applies to string types.

minimum.description: A value of a number must greater than, or equal to, the value of this. Only evaluated if the value is not null. Only applies to numeric values.

exclusiveMinimum.description: A value of a number must greater than the value of this. Only evaluated if the value is not null. Only applies to numeric values.

maximum.description: A value of a number must less than, or equal to, the value of this. Only evaluated if the value is not null. Only applies to numeric values.

exclusiveMaximum.description: A value of a number must less than the value of this. Only evaluated if the value is not null. Only applies to numeric values.

example.description: An example value for this field.

pii.description: An indication, if this field contains Personal Identifiable Information (PII).

classification.description: The data class defining the sensitivity level for this field, according to the organization's classification scheme.

tags.description: Custom metadata to provide additional context.

$ref.description: A reference URI to a definition in the specification, internally or externally. Properties will be inherited from the definition.

definitions.description: Clear and concise explanations of syntax, semantic, and classification of business objects in a given domain.

domain.description: The domain in which this definition is valid.

name.description: The technical name of this definition.

title.description: The business name of this definition.

description.description: Clear and concise explanations related to the domain.

minLength.description: A value must be greater than or equal to this value. Applies only to string types.

maxLength.description: A value must be less than or equal to this value. Applies only to string types.

format.description: Specific format requirements for the value (e.g., 'email', 'uri', 'uuid').

pattern.description: A regular expression pattern the value must match. Applies only to string types.

pii.description: Indicates if the field contains Personal Identifiable Information (PII).

classification.description: The data class defining the sensitivity level for this field.

tags.description: Custom metadata to provide additional context.

type.description: The type of the schema. Typical values are dbt, bigquery, json-schema, sql-ddl, avro, protobuf, custom.

oneOf.description: The specification of the schema as a string.
The specification of the schema as an object.

schema.description: The schema of the data contract describes the syntax and semantics of provided data sets. It supports different schema types.

type.description: The type of the example data. Well-known types are csv, json, yaml, custom.

description.description: An optional string describing the example.

model.description: The reference to the model in the schema, e.g., a table name.

oneOf.description: Example data for this model in a structured format. Use this for type json or yaml.

examples.description: The Examples Object is an array of Example Objects.

type.description: The type of the quality check. Typical values are SodaCL, montecarlo, custom.

oneOf.description: The specification of the quality attributes as a string.
The specification of the quality attributes as an object.

quality.description: The quality object contains quality attributes and checks.
